website_summaries.verdict: This tent offers 2 vestibules for your gear and double layered doors for warmth and ventilation.
pros: Holds up in the wind and can keep you dry
cons: This tent is too small to hold 2 people and their gear comfortably

customer_reviews.title: A bit short
customer_reviews.text: Generally, this tent is a pretty good deal, but at 78", it is just about 6" or so too short for a 6'2" person like myself. It is a 4 season tent which means that it has less built in venting in the walls of the tent, but venting for cold weather camping can be accomplished by opening vents built into the doors. It could use some better stake offs for the rain fly to help to make sure that the rainfly does not contact the tent. The vestibules are larger than other backpacking tents I have seen... especially at this price and that is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: bbneo

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this as a base camp tent and spent a few nights in it.It was strong and warm.At the cost it’s an extraordinary tent, yet a few things to know about:This isn’t a hiking tent,it weighs 5.9lbs.This is a 4 season tent and ,materials are thick and robust,for ventilation only 2 mesh windows and roof vents ,it requires a taut pitch with all guylines and stakes for minimal condensation.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Musician

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Both times we have taken it out camping, it has rained and we have stayed completely dry. The first time was a complete thunderstorm/downpour and no water got in the tent at all. All zippers work very well, material is good quality and seams and stitching seems very secure. The tent fits me (5'4", 135lb) and my boyfriend (6'2", 190lbs) comfortably and that is about it. This is not a large tent. You probably could fit a small dog in with us, but our Pit Bull and Bulldog sleep in their kennels in our van - they would never fit except for on top of us.
customer_reviews.author: HarvardJDog

customer_reviews.title: Good choice if you are not super tall and don't care too much about weight.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect for me (5'4") but my 6'4" boyfriend has to lay diagonal and still touches both ends. So if you are a longboy, size up. Other than that it is easy to put up and pack down and I have used it backpacking multiple times. It isn't the lightest or smallest tent for backpacking (it takes up about half of my 55L Bag space-wise), so if you are really counting ounces, you may need to shell out more cash for a lighter/smaller one. But for 2-3 day weekender trips, this it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: recommend it
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent on a-5day excursion through the southwest and it was marvellous for wild camping ! It rained on us relentlessly for 2days and this offered a great place to rest and wait out the weather in spite of the uncommon temperatures changes We stayed warm and none fo the gear got wet.A small amount of condensation was found on the fly in the morning but that was minor . I would recommend this tent with clear conscience !
customer_reviews.author: xin li

customer_reviews.title: Great in storms
customer_reviews.text: This tent is fantastic. I used it with my son, and we were hit with a pretty big storm. This tent had no problem. While it was pouring outside we were nice and dry. While the wind was blowing it never felt like it was going to collapse or uproot. I am 6’1 and slept comfortably. I Imagine it would be slightly uncomfortable at about 6’4, but it can easily sleep two adults. Great product. I will be recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck G

customer_reviews.title: Top product for the price! just make it couple foot larger PLEASE!
customer_reviews.text: top top top! I love this tent. with all the fine tiny yet efficient details that have. reflective strips, smooth sturdy zippers, vents, poles, etc. Have been using it for my camps so far in 3 seasons, not icy canadian winter though. I wont change a thing in it except the size, The only drawback is the size. this is 2 persons tent but actually it fits only 1 person with gear. too tight for two without their gear. Luxe Tempo, please either add at least 2foot in the width and another 2ft in the length. or make a 3 persons version. Looking forward to that.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Z.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a tremendous value
customer_reviews.text: It’s a tremendous value .Had it in some severe weather situations above the treeline,including 40 mph winds and heavy rain which drenched the entire campsite , it held up remarkably well.We brought extra tough stakes and guylines and tied down to rocks.For normal use the original stakes are enough.However,weight(5.7lb) is heavy for thru hike or long backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Big size
customer_reviews.text: It was like having my own hotel room on the trail. Got a couple of heavy sideways downpours in the middle of the nights,it was as loud as hail but not a drop of water got in.When gusts of chilly winds got under the rainfly I closed both windows to cut the wind and this caused some condensation building up on the walls.Bathtub floor was pretty strong on it's own for most normal uses,but you’d want a footprint if you are camping on rocky ground.Anyway,The price for the quality of this class was a great deal for me.And the extra durability is worth the weight in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Good tent bad seam tape job
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a good tent, but I never even got to use it. As I looked the tent over for defects I found two small missing sections of seam seal tape. Also apon further inspection there was a few sections of seam tape that was not even adhered to the fabric. The stitching was done quite well but with missing tape and so many places with tape that was not stuck to the fabric it's a leaker for sure
customer_reviews.author: gilius

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I own!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. I have had it all over the place. Set up and takedown are simple. No leaks! I love the reflective pieces on the fly makes it easy to see. It fits me and all my gear. Would sleep two fine. I am a 5’7” female. I spent 5 nights in November at Grand Canyon. At night it was 23 degrees F. I stayed warm. It’s versatile and fairly light weight for a four season tent. Can’t say enough good about it.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to setup, good quality
customer_reviews.text: The tent is very lightweight yet very stable once it's set up. The first time it took us a while to figure out how it needs to be set up. Once you've done it, it will become super easy. We are pleased that such a lightweight tent turns out to be a very well built one. We've already used it for camping twice and it holds up very well. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yang Chen

customer_reviews.title: Honestly a great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from a multiple day heavy duty car camping. We took this tent on its maiden voyage. It was good in ready bad conditions as it was meant to, no damage to the pole or material. There were some nights when temps got down to 30, we stayed toasty inside and were surprised how much warmth the tent have maintained. It’s probably the most solid tent we’ve been in, every detail was considered, especially for cool weather camping.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am on a trail crew and used this on top of mount Rogers to deal with cold night, it rained about five or six nights when the temps were in the low 30s and the ground was saturated, but there was no sign of leaking or anything remaining wet, we stayed warm and dry inside. For our purpose it performed exceptionally well , but you certainly need a footprint to to prevent wears camping on rugged terrain.
customer_reviews.author: dune

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality tent
customer_reviews.text: Such a great and high quality tent. It’s winter time now in New York, not a good time for camping yet. Therefore I have set up this tent in my backyard. The double layers door design prevent the tent from the wind, so inside will keep warm, And it says it’s good for 4 seasons. So it must be water and snow proof as well. I can’t wait to take this tent to my first camping on this year.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia Anna

customer_reviews.title: Built well and strong
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty heavy duty ,suited for a lot of situations.We camped at high elevations where the site was not as sheltered as deep in the forest. I bought extra stakes and guy lines for windy conditions.The tent was stable as a tank at 30mph with some snow piled on it.The full fabric doors behind the mesh windows really made a world of difference when the temperatures dipped below freezing in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: W.C

customer_reviews.title: Worth it at twice the price!
customer_reviews.text: Received today and set it up. Very happy with quality of construction and roominess. I have had countless tents over my 50+ camping years, and this tent is worth it at twice the price. I did read a couple of negative reviews on this product, but as far as I am concerned they are baseless. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TVCarpenter

customer_reviews.title: We love to go camping during the summer
customer_reviews.text: We love to go camping during the summer, we have an old tent but it started to wear out. We bought this one to replace the old one. It showed up before our camping trip, it's easy to put together, and holds up very well. The weather was hot and dry, so we didn't get chance to see if it would hold up against rain. We like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Agar

customer_reviews.title: Kept me dry
customer_reviews.text: Tested the tent out during a proper rain storm and it kept me completely dry and I slept great. Easy to put up and tear down. Packs down small and light. Poles don't feel super durable which might concern me in high winds but I don't get much wind where I camp. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I would not think twice to recommend this tent
customer_reviews.text: As a mountain guide I’m very critical of the quality and value of the gear.Took this tent for its first trip in the high mountains where it had the challenge of standing up against really rugged winter conditions.After sevral days of training course I had nothing but great things to say about the tent. It worked wonderfully in wild downpours at night.I stayed warm and dry at 11000 feet without major problems even though the wind was so bad and the rain pounded so hard!
customer_reviews.author: Sueky

customer_reviews.title: Order If You Want a Leaking Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent will do fine if you want a toy for your children to set up in the living room and play camp-out. But if you plan on taking this tent outdoors, this tent is not for you. It leaks, and badly. The floor has a seam, which is untaped. A small tent this size has no need for a seam in the floor! That is just one of several water penetration points. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J B

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS TENT! It's great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this in the winter yet but I have in the Fall (in upstate New York: 35-45 degree weather at night). It fits my boyfriend and I perfectly including some of our smaller bags. I am 5'6 and he is about 5'8-5'9 and we still had a little bit of room. Very good price for the high quality it provides!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great experience with this tent!
customer_reviews.text: After a weekend camping,it withstood some wind gusts all night long on top of the mountains and kept everything inside dry even when water soaked everything underneath it(with footprint).The only downer was that it was a bit too small for 2 big guys with a ton of gear.The features we liked about it were:two-way zippers,full privacy and 2 vestibules.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Little Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the money! Easy to set up. I used it this past week through 2 days of snow and 2 days of rain all in a row. It didn't leak at all. My only problem was condensatuon, but once I vented it and used a small portable fan directed at top condensation was no longer an issue. I did a poor job with the footprint (oversized tarp not made for this tent) and lots of water got underneath. This posed no problems. A little small for 2 people, but you know what they say, always buy one size larger for tents. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent, but tent bag not as durable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent. Have used it while road tripping for the last 3 months in super rainy, hot, and cold nights (down to 30 degrees). Provides great ventilation during hot nights. Need to use tarp during rainy days so that water doesn't leak through bottom. It condenses down into reasonable size for hikes into camp sites. My only complaint is the bag used to carry tent is already ripped completely (I purchased it in January). Will probably have to look for new carrier within the week because it no longer holds tent. But seriously...great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Koree R

customer_reviews.title: Truly a well made and solid tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent was awesome on it’s first outing in an exposed area at 4000ft. Setting up was simple and easy in 20mph winds. A lot of heat got trapped in the tent with so much coverage of the fly and inner. We camped dry and warm when temps dropped below zero at night.The only con was that the stakes were only for soft ground, better upgrade them with some heavy duty stakes.
customer_reviews.author: UmbralSyzygy

customer_reviews.title: Went together very easily in under 5min
customer_reviews.text: Set up in house to check it out {thunderstorm outside}. Went together very easily in under 5min. Size is perfect for us {I'm 5'8"/wife is 5'6"}. Has more headroom than our last tent. Great to have 2 entrance/exits. Pocket holding areas inside look very convenient including hook at top to hold a light. See no problem with zippers as others have said. Yosemite here we come!
customer_reviews.author: Jay A. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: I have the single person version and like it but needed more room with 2 people so the choice was easy. Easy set up, not a drop of rain in several heavy rains. I ride Motorcycle and often just go and these fit in a bag that's strapped to the tour pack rack.
customer_reviews.author: Allen P.

customer_reviews.title: ... our first mini camping trip and it sure didn't disappoint. The tent was easy to set up and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent to be used for our first mini camping trip and it sure didn't disappoint. The tent was easy to set up and fold away, it was roomy enough for the two of us to stay in. The tent was well made and sturdy enough to hold the winds that we were experiencing during the trip. Also love the fact that it had mesh window on two sides which gave us excellent views while inside the tent. Can't wait to use it again on our next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Impressive performance on the first trip
customer_reviews.text: This tent was sturdily built like a bomb shelter.Been using it heavily on our first outing of long mountain trek.It rained almost the whole time with relentless wind.Amazing we stayed intact when the rain flooded under the tent floor,it was like sleeping on a water bed but it didn't leak one bit with an old footprint layed underside. We absolutely loved the performance.Notice: A little heavy for long distance backpacking trips.Small amount of condensation was found on the fly,but no dampness was caused .
customer_reviews.author: Brian.feng

customer_reviews.title: It was surprisingly solid.
customer_reviews.text: I camped on my motorcycle with a friend.We were not expecting harsh conditions but there were significant winds at any good time. Tent was not the lightweight option.But It completely eliminated winds and easily withstood 40+mph gusts.The rainfly also offered a lot of coverage and high-rise floor greatly avoided splash back from the rain during a serious downpour.
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Last week we've had perfect adventures with this tent. It has withstood each wind and substantial rain throughout the trip. And it was pleasantly warm at night. I checked the weight, the scale indicates 2.65 kg,it’s a little on the heavy side. But when you need a robust tent, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin situ

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter
customer_reviews.text: Two thumbs up ! It was like at home in this tent.Double-track zippers made it possible to zip up one of the fabric doors to block out the icy wind and leave the other open for air circulation. The materials are superb .Gone thru some severe rain in bone-numbing temps with no problems.Have no idea about the performance on warmer trips,but basically this is a decent shelter for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you....this keeps you WARM!!! way better than any tent we have ever owned! Highly rate this tent in my book as best tent ever. You wont regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Prototype Collector

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Took this to big bend and everyone else ended up with layers of dust in their tents but I didn't. Well made, good size, good zippers, didn't catch the wind like others.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Miller

customer_reviews.title: For our use it’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: It fit 2 mats and pitches quite easy.In our opinion,it’s more robust than most tents we had.Not a bank breaker though.We think it’s a hard-to-beat combination of price and weather resistance.Really impressed it coped so well in particularly brutal wind and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Fong

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent after using my friend’s. We used it for a 3 months mission trip and doing some fieldwork in southwest UT last year. It served us well and held up nicely in all weather conditions even in the 20s with rain. I can’t wait to take it for its first trip!
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Very good. The tent was freaking awesome for the price ! Used it for a week long wilderness trip in the Allegheny National Forest without any issues.It held up firm and stayed bone dry in pummeling rain throughout the night.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good design and quality
customer_reviews.text: It is really a good quality tent, It is well designed and made. When I finished setting up the tent, it began to rain, this two layers tent keeps the interior well dry, and at the same time keeps it well ventilated. Vestibule doors can be fully closed or partially open for ventilation and sun shade, very good design. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sun

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Tent
customer_reviews.text: My first trial run was a week-long trip to Middle Settlement Lake with night temps around 20 and nearly constant overnight rain.The tent yield great results.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Very good for price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent for price. Reasonable weight, spacious vestibules, handy overhead net basket, stable setup.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Writer

customer_reviews.title: It was worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4 and I can sleep lengthwise in this tent We camped through 45 degree Fahrenheit Florida nights one with medium rain. Stayed dry and relatively warm. The set up is 10 minutes with two people and easy for one adult. My 10 year old can do it. I recommend the underlayment for this tent it protects the floor. One thing you need to vent this tent at night in the cold it is sealed tight enough that your overnight breathing will create condensation on the inside of the tent..
customer_reviews.author: Xenaquatic

customer_reviews.title: Great tent and lost of room
customer_reviews.text: Great tent and lost of room. The rain drop is also a great cover. Just a couple lbs heavier than my preference but other than that I enjoyed it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent on a 2-week road trip. So easy to set up and take down, small pack size. Snugly fit my husband, myself and our dog at our feet. A great tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Hetman

customer_reviews.title: But great tent no complaints
customer_reviews.text: A little bit small for me. But great tent no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Quick to set up and very lightweight. I like the rain guard and how you can lift up to create a small awning.
customer_reviews.author: carson

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 season tent
customer_reviews.text: Great 4 season tent! Awesome that it has the convenient doors on both sides, a nice hanging net for the center, plenty of room and good space on both sides under the rain fly for packs. Got to test it in fairly torrential rain the first time out. Held up spectacularly. Also due to a poor ground tarp we laid, we found out the bottom of the tent is quite waterproof! Very lightweight, easy to throw onto a pack. 2 poles, super easy set up. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrated dies pop up I’ve wrestled with it fir 30 minutes
customer_reviews.author: laurie apple

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: broken zipper on first night of use. otherwise as described
customer_reviews.author: Shoho

customer_reviews.title: Where's the hammock?
customer_reviews.text: I just got this tent and set it up. It looks great and it's the perfect size for what I want it for. I wanted a tent big enough to protect myself and my gear in all weather. It looks like it will do everything I need it to do and seems to be very well made. I haven't had it out in the weather yet but it looks like it will handle it. I'm excited to take this on my next adventure. I gave it 4 stars due to the fact that I thought this package was supposed to come with a hammock. I don't know if they forgot to pack one or not.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent. Plenty of space even for a cot ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. Plenty of space even for a cot and gear. Used it backpacking a few times now, including through a thunderstorm and high winds, and no problems at all, no water at all. I did seal the seams, but I always do. I will buy it again and I've spent 3 times this amount on a backpacking tent before (which was awesome also, but eventually wore out...just too much money).
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL O.

customer_reviews.title: Zipper on door broke
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice tent but the zipper for the door came off the tracks after only 4 days of use and unfortunately I'm 7 days past my return date on here
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in my living room. Looks very good, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Huston

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have extra storage space as shown in picture
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have the extended floor mat as shown in the picture. I only bought this tent seeing the extended floor mat so that I can use it to store my trekking bag and other stuffs but when I got it and build it, it doesn't exist
customer_reviews.author: Aadesh Neupane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tent For The Dollars
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems like a robust design when properly staked .It has just survived some sub-freezing temperatures and pummeling rain in the Midwest and Appalachians!
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Kong

product_meta.title: Luxe Tempo 2 Person 4 Season Tents Freestanding for Camping Backpacking Aluminum Poles All Weather Tested & Approved 2 Door 2 Vestibules Reflective
feature_bullets: Inner Tent is constructed from a LARGE PANEL of 210T highly breathable polyester for great cold-weather protection and dry weather views;Mesh roof and DOUBLE-LAYERED doors for HIGH-LOW cross ventilation and greatly reduces condensation,offering outstanding warm-weather performance

This tent is designed to deliver years'service;TESTED and RELIABLE Water Resistance:FULLY TAPED Rip-Stop rain fly with 3000mm PU coating;TAPED BATHTUBE tent floor and carefully welded corners keeps you and your gear bone dry even in storm rain

Multi-functional MESH GEAR LOFT not only offering handy storage for essentials,but also helping diffusing the light to create a comfortable and even glow through the whole tent when its empty;REINFORCED TENT CORNERS can sustain constant tension and pulling;SBS?zippers won??t drive you crazy

2 VESTIBULES provides ample gear storage space;vestibule doors can be affixed to fully closed or partially open for ventilation and sun shade while maintaining gear coverage; Mesh layer of the doors can be opened ONLY FROM INSIDE ,this feature can stop naughty intruder and offer absolute privacy in wilderness ;Reasonable peak height for abundant headroom to sit straight

Mesurements:Floor,55.1 * 82.6 in.;Peak Height,43.3 in.;Vestibule:8.7 sq.ft+6.8 sq.ft; Packed Weight:5.7 LBs; Accessories:2 guylines,12 aluminum stakes; FOOTPRINT is a must-have to increase a tent's life ;Best Use:Car Camping,Backcountry Adventures,Alpine,Backpacking;Please scroll down to get the designerÂ¡Â¯note for this version of Luxe Tempo Tent (footprint,sleeping pads and bags are for better presentation and are sold seperately)
